private_information: I can only move vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that they achieve the target tower ordering A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, with N on the table.

private_information: I can only move consonant-labeled blocks: C, G, J, F, L, K, B, D, M, N, H
I can only interact with blocks that are at the top of a stack
I can move only one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that they achieve the target tower ordering A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, with N on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate analyses from both agents and produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that solves the block rearrangement goal while keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: There are blocks labeled C, G, E, I, A, J, F, L, K, B, D, M, N, H.
I is on top of E.
A is on top of G.
J is on top of I.
L is on top of C.
K is on top of J.
B is on top of L.
D is on top of F.
M is on top of K.
N is on top of D.
H is on top of B.
Both agents can only move blocks that are currently on top of a stack and may move only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to vowel blocks and the other to consonant blocks.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert analyst for block-manipulation tasks. Inspect the initial configuration and the global goal and produce a step-by-step sequence of allowed moves restricted to the vowel blocks you can move. For each move include the preconditions and effects in plain text and identify any dependencies on moves of consonant blocks. Do not produce PDDL; produce a clear structured plan and notes suitable for the orchestrator to convert into PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Provide a stepwise action list limited to vowel-block moves in the form 'move X from Y to Z' with preconditions and effects and explicit notes about required consonant moves you depend on.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert analyst for block-manipulation tasks. Inspect the initial configuration and the global goal and produce a step-by-step sequence of allowed moves restricted to the consonant blocks you can move. For each move include the preconditions and effects in plain text and identify any dependencies on moves of vowel blocks. Do not produce PDDL; produce a clear structured plan and notes suitable for the orchestrator to convert into PDDL.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Provide a stepwise action list limited to consonant-block moves in the form 'move X from Y to Z' with preconditions and effects and explicit notes about required vowel moves you depend on.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL generation targeted at the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the plans and analyses from the agents and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by prefixing or otherwise namespacing their action names. Include types and predicates for blocks, table, on, clear, holding, handempty, and top predicates that capture the top-of-stack constraint. Ensure initial state and goal reflect the provided information.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive the analyses from two agents. Use them to produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that solves the global goal while keeping agent actions distinct. Here is the vowel-agent analysis: {plan_vowel}. Here is the consonant-agent analysis: {plan_consonant}. Public information to respect: {environment->public_information}. Global goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Think step by step and produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem enclosed between <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
